alert.note: Alert for Johnston; Nash; Wilson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 21 at 5:04PM EDT until May 21 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN NASH...SOUTHWESTERN WILSON AND NORTHEASTERN JOHNSTON COUNTIES... At 504 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 10 miles northeast of Smithfield, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Bailey, Micro, Kenly, Lucama, Middlesex and Buckhorn Reservoir. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
